channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Actively Exploited WSUS RCE Gets Emergency Patch After Initial Fix Fails
item.description:
Headline: Actively Exploited WSUS RCE Gets Emergency Patch After Initial Fix Fails

Summary:
A critical remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), tracked as CVE-2025-59287 with a 9.8 CVSS score, is being actively exploited in the wild. The situation was exacerbated by a failed initial patch, which prompted Microsoft to release an emergency out-of-band update. The flaw allows unauthenticated attackers to achieve SYSTEM-level privileges on vulnerable servers. Due to confirmed in-the-wild attacks, CISA has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating swift action from federal agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-59287) in Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is under active attack. Learn about the failed patch, emergency update, and mitigation steps.

Article Slug: critical-microsoft-wsus-rce-flaw-actively-exploited-after-botched-patch

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Qilin Ransomware Claims 700 Victims in 2025, Becoming Top Global Threat
item.description:
Headline: Qilin Ransomware Claims 700 Victims in 2025, Becoming Top Global Threat

Summary:
The Qilin ransomware group has dramatically escalated its activities in 2025, claiming over 700 attacks to become the year's most prolific ransomware operation. Operating a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model, the Russia-based group has far surpassed the activity of 2024's leader, RansomHub. A significant surge in Qilin's attacks followed the shutdown of the RansomHub operation in April 2025, suggesting a migration of affiliates. Qilin aggressively targets critical infrastructure sectors worldwide, including healthcare, finance, and government, using double-extortion tactics.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: Analysis of the Qilin ransomware group, which has become the most active RaaS operation in 2025 with over 700 victims, targeting critical infrastructure globally.

Article Slug: qilin-ransomware-surges-to-become-most-prolific-threat-of-2025

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Headline: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data

Summary:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external file transfer system and that the nation's core power grid operations and electricity supply were not affected. An investigation is underway to determine the scope of the compromised data.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group has claimed a data breach against Sweden's national power grid operator, Svenska kraftnät, allegedly stealing 280 GB of data from an external system.

Article Slug: swedish-power-grid-operator-svenska-kraftnat-hit-by-everest-ransomware

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Breach at Kenyan Health Platform M-TIBA Exposes 4.8 Million Patients
item.description:
Headline: Massive Breach at Kenyan Health Platform M-TIBA Exposes 4.8 Million Patients

Summary:
A threat actor named 'Kazu' has claimed responsibility for a catastrophic data breach against M-TIBA, a major mobile health platform in Kenya backed by Safaricom. The hacker alleges the theft of 2.15 terabytes of data, impacting up to 4.8 million users. The compromised information reportedly includes a vast trove of personally identifiable information (PII) and highly sensitive protected health information (PHI), such as patient diagnoses and treatment records from nearly 700 healthcare facilities. A 2GB data sample has already been leaked to substantiate the claim.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A massive data breach at M-TIBA, a Kenyan mobile health platform, has allegedly exposed the personal and medical data of 4.8 million users. A threat actor known as 'Kazu' is responsible.

Article Slug: massive-data-breach-at-kenyan-health-platform-m-tiba-hits-millions

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Global Fuel Gauge Systems, Risking Infrastructure Disruption
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Global Fuel Gauge Systems, Risking Infrastructure Disruption

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued a critical advisory for two vulnerabilities in Veeder-Root's TLS4B Automatic Tank Gauge (ATG) systems, which are used globally to monitor fuel levels. The most severe flaw, CVE-2025-58428, has a CVSS score of 9.9 and could allow a remote, authenticated attacker to execute system-level commands, potentially causing widespread disruption to fuel infrastructure. A second flaw, CVE-2025-55067, relates to the 'Year 2038' problem and could cause denial-of-service conditions.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA has issued a critical advisory for two vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-58428, CVE-2025-55067) in Veeder-Root TLS4B Automatic Tank Gauge systems, which could lead to remote code execution and disruption of fuel infrastructure.

Article Slug: cisa-issues-alert-for-critical-flaws-in-veeder-root-fuel-gauge-systems

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical Apache Tomcat Flaws Expose Servers to RCE and Console Hijacking
item.description:
Headline: Critical Apache Tomcat Flaws Expose Servers to RCE and Console Hijacking

Summary:
The Apache Software Foundation has released patches for two critical vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-55752 and CVE-2025-55754, affecting Apache Tomcat versions 9, 10, and 11. The most severe flaw, CVE-2025-55752, is a directory traversal bug that can be escalated to remote code execution (RCE) if non-default settings like PUT requests are enabled. The second flaw could allow for console manipulation on Windows systems. Administrators are urged to upgrade to the latest versions immediately.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Apache has patched two critical vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-55752, CVE-2025-55754) in Tomcat versions 9, 10, and 11 that could lead to directory traversal, RCE, and console manipulation. Upgrade immediately.

Article Slug: critical-apache-tomcat-flaws-expose-servers-to-rce-and-console-manipulation

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: North Korea's BlueNoroff APT Targets macOS Users with New 'GhostCall' Malware
item.description:
Headline: North Korea's BlueNoroff APT Targets macOS Users with New 'GhostCall' Malware

Summary:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group BlueNoroff has been linked to two new sophisticated campaigns, 'GhostCall' and 'GhostHire,' which specifically target macOS users. According to Kaspersky, the financially motivated group, a subset of the Lazarus Group, is targeting venture capitalists and Web3 developers with fake Zoom and Microsoft Teams clients, AI-enhanced social engineering, and a new suite of malware designed to steal cryptocurrency. Victims have been identified globally, including in Japan, Italy, France, and Singapore.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: The North Korean APT group BlueNoroff (APT38) is targeting macOS users in the crypto sector with new malware campaigns 'GhostCall' and 'GhostHire,' using sophisticated social engineering to steal cryptocurrency.

Article Slug: north-koreas-bluenoroff-apt-deploys-new-macos-malware-in-sophisticated-campaigns

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Victim Payments Plummet to Record Low of 23% in Q3 2025
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Victim Payments Plummet to Record Low of 23% in Q3 2025

Summary:
The rate of ransomware victims paying ransoms fell to a record low of 23% in the third quarter of 2025, according to a report from Coveware. This decline is driven by two key factors: large enterprises are increasingly refusing to pay, recognizing the low utility of doing so in data exfiltration cases, and major RaaS groups like Akira and Qilin are shifting their focus to high-volume attacks on mid-market firms with smaller ransom demands. Despite the lower payment rate, the overall volume of ransomware incidents remains at an all-time high.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: Ransomware payment rates dropped to a historic low of 23% in Q3 2025 as large enterprises increasingly refuse to pay and groups like Akira and Qilin target mid-market firms, according to Coveware.

Article Slug: ransomware-payments-hit-historic-low-of-23-percent-in-q3-2025

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 183 Million Email Credentials Exposed in Massive Infostealer Malware Leak
item.description:
Headline: 183 Million Email Credentials Exposed in Massive Infostealer Malware Leak

Summary:
A massive dataset containing 183 million unique email addresses and their corresponding plaintext passwords has been discovered circulating on the dark web and added to the Have I Been Pwned database. The data, dubbed the "Synthient Stealer Log Threat Data," was not sourced from a breach of any single provider like Gmail, but was compiled from logs harvested by infostealer malware from millions of compromised user devices worldwide. The leak highlights the pervasive threat of infostealers and poses a severe risk of credential stuffing attacks across the internet.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A huge dataset from infostealer malware logs, containing 183 million unique email addresses and passwords, has been discovered. This was not a direct breach of any service but theft from users' devices, posing a massive credential stuffing risk.

Article Slug: 183-million-email-credentials-exposed-through-infostealer-malware

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding
item.description:
Headline: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding

Summary:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is set for a 'generational change' in maritime cybersecurity, according to an analysis by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). Nearly $25 billion in new funding, combined with expanded regulatory authorities, will allow the USCG to comprehensively modernize its systems, implement a zero-trust architecture, and enforce new cybersecurity standards across the entire U.S. Marine Transportation System. The move signals a major strategic shift, elevating cyberspace to an operational domain on par with air, land, and sea.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: An analysis by CSIS highlights a 'generational change' for the U.S. Coast Guard's cybersecurity capabilities, backed by nearly $25 billion in funding to modernize systems and regulate the maritime industry.

Article Slug: us-coast-guard-receives-billions-in-funding-for-maritime-cybersecurity-overhaul

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Motex LANSCOPE RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
Headline: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Motex LANSCOPE RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical vulnerability in Motex's LANSCOPE Endpoint Manager, CVE-2025-61932, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog following confirmation of active attacks. The flaw, rated 9.3 CVSS, allows for unauthenticated remote code execution on affected endpoints. Attackers have reportedly been weaponizing the vulnerability to install backdoors on victim systems, primarily observed in Japan. Federal agencies are now mandated to patch by November 12, 2025.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA has added CVE-2025-61932, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Motex's LANSCOPE Endpoint Manager, to its KEV catalog due to active exploitation in the wild.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-critical-motex-lanscope-vulnerability-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Over-Privileged Active Directory Domain-Join Accounts Create Major Security Risk
item.description:
Headline: Over-Privileged Active Directory Domain-Join Accounts Create Major Security Risk

Summary:
A new security analysis reveals that Active Directory (AD) domain-join accounts, even when configured according to official guidance, often inherit excessive privileges that create a reliable pathway for attackers to achieve full domain compromise. These specialized accounts, used for automated machine provisioning, can have their credentials exposed during deployment. Attackers can then abuse the account's powerful default permissions, such as object ownership and rights related to Resource-Based Constrained Delegation (RBCD), to escalate privileges and take over computer objects.

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A security analysis highlights how over-privileged Active Directory domain-join accounts, whose credentials are often exposed, create a significant risk for privilege escalation and domain compromise via RBCD attacks.

Article Slug: active-directory-at-risk-from-over-privileged-domain-join-accounts

Published Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Microsoft Report: AI-Generated Phishing Now 4.5x More Effective, Bypassing Traditional Defenses
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Report: AI-Generated Phishing Now 4.5x More Effective, Bypassing Traditional Defenses

Summary:
According to the Microsoft 2025 Digital Defense Report, the effectiveness of phishing attacks has surged with the adoption of artificial intelligence. AI-generated emails now achieve a 54% click-through rate, 4.5 times higher than traditional methods. The report, covering July 2024 to June 2025, also highlights a 32% increase in identity-based attacks and the growing use of AI by nation-state actors for disinformation. Microsoft stresses that phishing-resistant MFA remains the most effective defense, blocking over 99% of identity attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Malware

Article Type: Report

Keywords: AI phishing, Microsoft Digital Defense Report 2025, phishing effectiveness, identity based attacks, phishing resistant MFA, ClickFix attack, cybersecurity trends, generative AI threats

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's 2025 Digital Defense Report finds AI-generated phishing emails are 4.5 times more effective, with a 54% click-through rate, fueling a surge in identity-based attacks.

Article Slug: ai-powered-phishing-emails-prove-4-5-times-more-effective-microsoft-report-finds

Published Date: Sat, 18 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 18 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 2

Update History: 2 updates recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: 18 Minutes to Mayhem: Ransomware Attacks Now Fully Automated, Slashing Defender Response Time
item.description:
Headline: 18 Minutes to Mayhem: Ransomware Attacks Now Fully Automated, Slashing Defender Response Time

Summary:
A new report from ReliaQuest reveals a dramatic acceleration in ransomware attacks, with the average time from initial access to lateral movement ('breakout time') plummeting to just 18 minutes. This is a significant decrease from 48 minutes in 2024, driven by the adoption of automation and AI by 80% of Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) groups. The report highlights the Qilin ransomware gang as a prime example, whose platform automates key attack phases like discovery, backup deletion, and encryption. Other groups like LockBit are also integrating AI to enhance their operations, creating a hyper-competitive landscape where speed and automation are paramount. This shrinking response window poses a monumental challenge for security teams, demanding automated detection and response capabilities to counter the threat.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: Ransomware attacks have accelerated dramatically, with the average time from initial access to lateral movement now just 18 minutes, driven by automation and AI used by groups like Qilin and LockBit.

Article Slug: ransomware-automation-cuts-attack-timelines-to-18-minutes

Published Date: Thu, 23 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 23 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited Critical WSUS Flaw
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited Critical WSUS Flaw

Summary:
Microsoft has released an urgent, out-of-band security update for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), tracked as CVE-2025-59287. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 9.8, is being actively exploited in the wild, allowing unauthenticated attackers to achieve complete system control with SYSTEM privileges. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating immediate patching for federal agencies and strongly urging all organizations to apply the update without delay.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency out-of-band patch for a critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-59287) in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) that is under active attack.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-critical-wsus-flaw-cve-2025-59287

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Qilin Ransomware Attacks Skyrocket, Becoming 2025's Most Prolific Group
item.description:
Headline: Qilin Ransomware Attacks Skyrocket, Becoming 2025's Most Prolific Group

Summary:
The Russia-based Qilin ransomware group has become the most active ransomware operation of 2025, claiming 701 victims as of late October. This dramatic surge, representing a 280% increase since April, is largely attributed to the group absorbing affiliates from the defunct RansomHub operation. Qilin employs a double-extortion model, targeting critical infrastructure sectors such as manufacturing, healthcare, finance, and government, with the United States being the most heavily impacted nation. High-profile attacks have resulted in massive data theft and significant financial damages, cementing Qilin's status as a top-tier cyber threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Qilin ransomware group has claimed over 700 victims in 2025, making it the most active ransomware operation and targeting critical sectors worldwide.

Article Slug: qilin-ransomware-attacks-skyrocket-to-700-in-2025

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive 'Smishing Triad' Campaign Used 194,000+ Domains to Harvest Data
item.description:
Headline: Massive 'Smishing Triad' Campaign Used 194,000+ Domains to Harvest Data

Summary:
A massive smishing (SMS phishing) campaign attributed to the China-linked 'Smishing Triad' threat group has used over 194,000 malicious domains since the beginning of 2024. The operation, which escalated significantly in April, impersonates trusted entities like the US Postal Service, the IRS, banks, and toll services to trick victims into divulging sensitive personal information, including Social Security numbers. The campaign's infrastructure is designed for rapid turnover to evade detection, with many domains active for less than two days.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A massive smishing campaign linked to the 'Smishing Triad' has used over 194,000 malicious domains to impersonate postal services, banks, and government agencies to steal sensitive personal information.

Article Slug: china-linked-smishing-campaign-used-194000-domains

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns
item.description:
Headline: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns

Summary:
A critical improper input validation vulnerability in Adobe Commerce and Magento, tracked as CVE-2025-54236, is being actively exploited in the wild. Dubbed 'SessionReaper,' the flaw allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to hijack user sessions via the REST API, leading to potential web shell deployment and complete store takeover. CISA has added the vulnerability to its KEV catalog, and with reports suggesting over 60% of Magento stores remain unpatched, immediate action is urged for all administrators.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A critical session hijacking vulnerability (CVE-2025-54236) in Adobe Commerce and Magento is under active exploitation, allowing attackers to deploy web shells. CISA has added it to the KEV catalog.

Article Slug: critical-adobe-commerce-flaw-cve-2025-54236-under-active-exploitation

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Lazarus Group Targets European Defense Firms with New 'ScoringMathTea' RAT
item.description:
Headline: Lazarus Group Targets European Defense Firms with New 'ScoringMathTea' RAT

Summary:
The North Korean state-sponsored threat actor, Lazarus Group, is behind a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign targeting European defense manufacturers, with a specific focus on companies producing Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). The attackers used social engineering tactics, including fake job offers and trojanized GitHub projects, to gain initial access. Once inside, they deployed a previously unknown Remote Access Trojan (RAT) named 'ScoringMathTea' to exfiltrate sensitive intellectual property, including proprietary drone designs.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The North Korea-linked Lazarus group is targeting European defense manufacturers with a new remote access trojan (RAT) called ScoringMathTea to steal proprietary UAV designs.

Article Slug: north-korean-lazarus-group-targets-european-defense-firms-with-new-rat

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ChatGPT Flaw Allows 'Memory Poisoning' via CSRF Attack
item.description:
Headline: ChatGPT Flaw Allows 'Memory Poisoning' via CSRF Attack

Summary:
A novel vulnerability discovered in OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas web browser allows attackers to perform 'memory poisoning' through a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack. Researchers at LayerX Security found that this flaw can be used to invisibly inject malicious instructions into ChatGPT's persistent 'Memory' feature. These instructions survive across sessions and devices, and can be triggered by a user's normal prompts to execute malicious code, potentially leading to account takeover or malware deployment.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A CSRF vulnerability in OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas web browser allows attackers to inject malicious instructions into the AI's persistent memory, leading to potential account takeover.

Article Slug: chatgpt-atlas-browser-vulnerability-allows-memory-poisoning

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: APT-C-60 Escalates 'SpyGlace' Campaign Against Japan
item.description:
Headline: APT-C-60 Escalates 'SpyGlace' Campaign Against Japan

Summary:
The South Korea-aligned cyber-espionage group APT-C-60 has significantly intensified its campaign against Japanese organizations in the third quarter of 2025. According to JPCERT/CC and Cyble, the group has deployed at least three new versions of its custom 'SpyGlace' backdoor. The attackers have evolved their tactics, now attaching malicious VHDX files directly to phishing emails and abusing legitimate services like GitHub and StatCounter for stealthy command-and-control communications and malware delivery, making detection more challenging.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The South Korea-aligned cyber-espionage group APT-C-60 has escalated its attacks against Japanese organizations, deploying updated versions of its 'SpyGlace' backdoor with enhanced evasion techniques.

Article Slug: apt-c-60-intensifies-cyber-espionage-campaign-against-japan

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Rushes Patch for Critical Chrome V8 RCE Flaw
item.description:
Headline: Google Rushes Patch for Critical Chrome V8 RCE Flaw

Summary:
Google has released an emergency security update for Google Chrome to address a critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-12036, in its V8 JavaScript engine. The flaw, described as an 'inappropriate implementation,' could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system by convincing them to visit a malicious website. The vulnerability was discovered by Google's own AI-driven research project, leading to a rapid patch release. All users of Chrome and other Chromium-based browsers are urged to update immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 3 minutes

Meta Description: Google has issued an emergency security update for a critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-12036) in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine, affecting Chrome and other Chromium-based browsers.

Article Slug: critical-google-chrome-v8-vulnerability-cve-2025-12036-allows-rce

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Data Breaches Hit Toys 'R' Us Canada, Askul, and Verisure
item.description:
Headline: Data Breaches Hit Toys 'R' Us Canada, Askul, and Verisure

Summary:
A wave of data breaches has impacted several consumer-facing companies globally. Toys "R" Us Canada has had customer records leaked on the dark web. Japanese retailer Askul suffered a disruptive ransomware attack that halted operations and may have resulted in a data leak. Additionally, Swedish security firm Verisure disclosed a breach affecting 35,000 customers via a third-party vendor, and U.S.-based Jewett-Cameron Trading reported the theft of financial documents.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Several consumer-facing companies including Toys 'R' Us Canada, Japanese retailer Askul, and Swedish security firm Verisure have disclosed data breaches, resulting in the theft of customer personal information.

Article Slug: data-breaches-hit-toys-r-us-askul-verisure

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Healthcare Sector Rocked by Breaches at ModMed, LifeBridge, and Right at Home
item.description:
Headline: Healthcare Sector Rocked by Breaches at ModMed, LifeBridge, and Right at Home

Summary:
The healthcare sector continues to be a prime target for cyberattacks, with recent data breaches announced by Electronic Health Record (EHR) provider Modernizing Medicine (ModMed), home healthcare provider Right at Home, and Baltimore-based LifeBridge Health. The incidents, which include a ransomware attack claimed by the Sinobi group and a third-party breach via Oracle Health, have exposed a vast range of sensitive Protected Health Information (PHI), including Social Security numbers, medical diagnoses, and financial data.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Data breaches have been announced by EHR provider Modernizing Medicine (ModMed), LifeBridge Health, and home healthcare provider Right at Home, exposing a wide range of patient and financial data.

Article Slug: healthcare-data-breaches-affect-modmed-lifebridge-right-at-home

Published Date: Mon, 27 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead

Summary:
Cybersecurity researchers report a staggering 50% increase in ransomware attacks in 2025, with over 5,000 incidents claimed on dark web leak sites by late October. This surge occurs amidst a significant realignment in the ransomware ecosystem, with formerly dominant groups fading while new and resurgent actors like Qilin take their place. The Qilin group has been particularly prolific, leading in victim counts for most of the past six months. The United States remains the most targeted nation, and the industrial sector is the most heavily impacted industry. PowerShell has become the primary tool for attackers, used in nearly 78% of observed campaigns.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A 50% surge in ransomware attacks is reported for 2025, with the Qilin group emerging as a dominant threat actor. The industrial sector is the most targeted, and PowerShell is the primary attack vector.

Article Slug: ransomware-attacks-skyrocket-50-percent-in-2025-qilin-emerges-as-leader
